dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey B, so did you catch the news about Amazon and Deliveroo? It's, like, a big deal over in the UK.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey B, so did you catch the news about Amazon and Deliveroo? It's, like, a big deal over in the U K.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, A! I saw something about the CMA, the Competition and Markets Authority, right? Uh, they're stepping in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, A! I saw something about the C M A, the Competition and Markets Authority, right? Uh, they're stepping in.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) issued an initial enforcement order on Friday over fears that the two companies have ceased to be distinct following a $575 million funding round into Deliveroo in May, which was led by Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! They've issued this initial enforcement order because they're worried the two companies, like, aren't distinct anymore.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! They've issued this initial enforcement order because they're worried the two companies, like, aren't distinct anymore.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) issued an initial enforcement order on Friday over fears that the two companies have ceased to be distinct

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and it's interesting because it's not even a full acquisition yet, is it? Amazon just led a big funding round, what was it, like, $575 million?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and it's interesting because it's not even a full acquisition yet, is it? Amazon just led a big funding round, what was it, like, five hundred seventy five million dollars?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) issued an initial enforcement order on Friday over fears that the two companies have ceased to be distinct following a $575 million funding round into Deliveroo in May, which was led by Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's it. It was a *minority* investment, which is what makes this whole probe a bit unusual, um, for the CMA to jump in so quickly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's it. It was a minority investment, which is what makes this whole probe a bit unusual, um, for the C M A to jump in so quickly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The probe from the CMA is somewhat unusual given Amazon is only a minority shareholder in Deliveroo

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, the article mentioned they have "reasonable grounds" to believe they're no longer distinct, but they didn't, like, specify what those grounds are.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, the article mentioned they have reasonable grounds to believe they're no longer distinct, but they didn't, like, specify what those grounds are.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, the CMA said it has reasonable grounds to believe the two companies are no longer distinct. It declined to specify what these reasonable grounds are

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, they didn't. [overlaps] But I guess it's probably public info, plus stuff they got privately from Amazon and Deliveroo. And they're worried about a future merger, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, they didn't. But I guess it's probably public info, plus stuff they got privately from Amazon and Deliveroo. And they're worried about a future merger, too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The CMA said it is also concerned that the two companies could merge at some point in the future.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which makes sense, right? Amazon tried food delivery before with Amazon Restaurants and, uh, it didn't really work out for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which makes sense, right? Amazon tried food delivery before with Amazon Restaurants and, uh, it didn't really work out for them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: a takeover would give the Seattle-based giant a second try at the food delivery business after it scrapped its rival service Amazon Restaurants in June.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And Deliveroo, they're huge, like, 70,000 riders, 90,000 restaurants across 16 countries. They need that investment to keep growing, especially with Uber Eats around.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And Deliveroo, they're huge, like, seventy thousand riders, ninety thousand restaurants across sixteen countries. They need that investment to keep growing, especially with Uber Eats around.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the company now operates in 500 towns and cities in 14 countries around the world. It relies on an army of 60,000 riders to transport food from 80,000 restaurants to people's homes and offices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but Amazon's saying, "Look, this is good for everyone! More choice for consumers, new jobs, helps restaurants expand."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but Amazon's saying, Look, this is good for everyone! More choice for consumers, new jobs, helps restaurants expand.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: An Amazon spokesperson said: We believe this minority investment will enable Deliveroo to expand its services, benefiting consumers through increased choice and creating new jobs as more restaurants gain access to the service.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, but, uh, regulators in Europe are really cracking down on these big US tech giants over potential monopolistic tactics. Like, they're watching closely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, but, uh, regulators in Europe are really cracking down on these big U S tech giants over potential monopolistic tactics. Like, they're watching closely.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, European regulators are clamping down on U.S. tech giants over allegedly monopolistic and uncompetitive tactics.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They really are. And the shares of other takeaway companies, like JustEat, actually *rose* when Amazon first announced this investment, which is kind of telling, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They really are. And the shares of other takeaway companies, like JustEat, actually rose when Amazon first announced this investment, which is kind of telling, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When Amazon announced that it planned to invest in Deliveroo, shares in takeaway firms across Europesuch as JustEat, Takeaway.com, and Delivery Herotumbled.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It is! It shows the market was kinda relieved, or maybe saw it as a sign of concern. [overlaps] And this IEO basically pauses the deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is! It shows the market was kinda relieved, or maybe saw it as a sign of concern. And this I E O basically pauses the deal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A spokeswoman for the CMA told Forbes that the initial enforcement order (IEO) has been issued to effectively pause the deal between Amazon and Deliveroo

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a strong signal that a Phase 1 investigation is coming, which could take, uh, 40 days.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a strong signal that a Phase one investigation is coming, which could take, uh, forty days.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The fact that the IEO has been issued is a strong indication that a Phase 1 investigation will be carried out, she said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And Deliveroo's argument is interesting: if they *don't* get this money from Amazon, they might go out of business. So, like, isn't that worse for consumers?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Deliveroo's argument is interesting: if they don't get this money from Amazon, they might go out of business. So, like, isn't that worse for consumers?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If Deliveroo failed to raise the money from Amazon, and it went out of business as a result, then it could be argued that it would be a worse outcome for consumers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's a good point. Though, uh, one expert said Deliveroo probably wouldn't have trouble finding other investors if this deal gets blocked.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a good point. Though, uh, one expert said Deliveroo probably wouldn't have trouble finding other investors if this deal gets blocked.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Erin Platts, head of Silicon Valley Bank in EMEA, told Forbes that Deliveroo wouldnt have too much difficulty finding other investors if the CMA prevented it from accepting money from Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So it's a bit of a high-stakes game of chicken, really. We'll have to see how this one plays out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's a bit of a high-stakes game of chicken, really. We'll have to see how this one plays out.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. Keep an eye on the CMA for that Phase 1 update.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. Keep an eye on the C M A for that Phase one update.
